result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony P Peters

records.addlTxt: Defendant can be released to go directly to Portage House Treatment and upon completion of the treatment program, whether voluntarily or involuntary termination. Defendant must return to FC jail and the $500 cash bond will be reinstated.

1:18 PM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video, in custody FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Recalled from this morning regarding treatment concern. Court this morning there was no verification, however before lunch COC brought up forwarding emails between ADA and probation, regarding being released to go to treatment at the Portage House. State has no objection. Court will modify bond to $5000 signature bond, can be released to go directly to Portage House Treatment and upon completion of the treatment program, whether voluntarily or involuntary. Defendant must return to FC jail and the $500 cash bond will be reinstated.

10:53 AM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court has received report from SPD indicating no attorney appointed to his case, court will have set for another date and continues bond. Peters indicates at last hearing the court would address bond, possible signature bond for a bed date. Court reviews file regarding representing himself, questions if he has a bed date. Peters indicates he had a bed date for today, agent talked with the DA's in FC, Shawano and Brown County agreed to send to treatment. State unaware of any contact from agent regarding Peters bed date. Court if paperwork can be produced then court can possibly do a furlough for treatment, court reduces bond to $500 cash.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:12 AM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no attorney from SPD yet, keep in constant contact with them, continues bond, set for AIA on 10/12/22 at 10:45 AM. Court asks about the option to go to Koinonia. Peters responds, have been available to him on 10/13/22 - part of ATR. Court will need verification from someone of the available bed and would then amend the bond to allow him to attend treatment. Peters asks for signature bond. State - bond - objects to signature bond for stated reasons. Court reviews file, last court hearing defendant mentioned hiring private counsel and was sent paperwork for that, asks where defendant is on that. Peters responds, will stick with SPD at this point until after ATR, does ask about court appointed counsel and if Court would appoint one due to SPD shortage. Court will review that option if it feels the defendant's constitutional rights are being violated by not getting an SPD appointed attorney when eligible, continues bond at this point, sets for AIA on 10/12/22 at 10:45 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:36  AM Defendant in custody appears via Zoom. State appears by Alex Seifert in person. Ct- last hearing said he would be appointed an attorney. Public Defender made contact 1,281 times. Check in with Public Defender. Ct- Defendant can proceed without attorney. Court will send Public defender email and find out policy. Can be heard with respect to bond. Cash bond of $1,000. ADA Seifert- requests bond stay at this time. Ct- continue $1,000 bond. Defendant- would proceed without an attorney. Ct- Will send form to waive rights to jail. Fill out and send back. Set for 10/05/22 at 9:15 Adj 9:42

9:57 AM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video, in custody form FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD  has appointed an attorney for Mr. Peters but she is not on the call today, Court continues bond, sets for another AIA on 9/28/22 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:50 AM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody from FOSO.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no attorney for defendant yet, set for another AIA. Peters asks if he can represent himself for this hearing. Court informs him that he does have that right and can go thru the waiver of right to counsel if defendant wishes, warns of the possible ramifications. Peters is just asking to represent himself on this hearing and schedule a PH. Court informs the defendant that that is not a possibility and explain the process, does see that the defendant has cases in both Brown and Shawano Counties. Defendant agrees. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 9/21/22 at 9:45 AM. Peters states he has a bed date at Koinonia on 9/27/22 and would like bond reduced so that he can go to Koinonia. Court directs defendant to contact his PO agent as it relates to the furlough request to go to Koinonia. Peters asks for bond reduction -  may have job working for Johnny Skenandore Construction Company. State - bond - objects to any bond reduction for stated reasons. Peters - bond - makes argument for bond reduction. Court - bond - continues bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Anthony P Peters appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint just a few minutes ago. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has contacted SPD, he does qualify and they will be appointing an attorney for him. State indicates bond can be reduced to $1000 cash. Peters asks for $500 signature bond. Court will amend bond to $1000 cash bond and has set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony P Peters
Current: 123 Madison Way, Shawano, WI 54166 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2022)
Prior: 1318 Lacounty Road, Green Bay, WI 54313
